title: edge case handling gossip on the transition boundary
body:
It looks like we're rejecting a gossip message on fork boundary because we're using the pre-state fork...

This was reported during a devnet. The devnet was similar to mainnet config, so 32 blocks per epoch. 

> right after bellatrix: 
> ```
> 2022-11-23 10:27:05.288 WARN  - Rejecting gossip message on topic /eth2/66ebd40c/sync_committee_contribution_and_proof/ssz_snappy, reason: Rejecting proof with signature 0x93ab576659aa724daef79cc8b0ce3d740b224c2d8e84b97efdbd7184b12fbb023e8303b83a1dbcf1f2df740814af52150d5564f288dca312ae247a7fc2ee423c3778ce20b3526e003ee915da34857a9ebe53b7595c25f1cce5e71d9d09befd27 because batch signature check failed, decoded message: 
> ```

decoded gossip message was:
```
message:
  aggregator_index: '70'
  contribution:
    slot: '64'
    beacon_block_root: '0x17a0d9ddd3711fcba220197f21557dbb1e58e6c8a257dd14027491d6acea6c08'
    subcommittee_index: '1'
    aggregation_bits: '0x0121409410483c001080012100141048'
    signature: >-
      0x93ab576659aa724daef79cc8b0ce3d740b224c2d8e84b97efdbd7184b12fbb023e8303b83a1dbcf1f2df740814af52150d5564f288dca312ae247a7fc2ee423c3778ce20b3526e003ee915da34857a9ebe53b7595c25f1cce5e71d9d09befd27
  selection_proof: >-
    0xa77c2d0f61acd1aeac35ca71e876ec688d59d0f485e786e287b99c6fe3a972f2cd125d8d233d6c6bc16e45ef7e75662815cc063e713c3fe910d5026f411e764c2075e38350e50464639536eb325aae4c92c2f92fe7077bf84d1e665bc497e44c
signature: >-
  0x92cbf341e1d55fe41663c3c680d7aac9709205d6d9003d04f57f7e907a0794989accfd8aa7b8c6de2800e36bfbe06d0c12aac385a8ca1e89fe8c576086e71582bdb74766b9a5f4761ebb898b5f4613276080675c4872630eda84a8e61a470b0a

```

I believe what's happening here is that the chain head state is still before the bellatrix fork activates and when validating gossip we're using the fork from that state. Since it only contains current and previous forks, it doesn't know about the bellatrix fork yet and gets the signature verification wrong.
